moves.1. e4: Here is an example of a chess game where I easily could have won but I just messed around thinking the game would be easy and resulted in getting checkmated.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5: Up till now it was quite a usual beginning game.
moves.4. a3: My opponent did a move that many people do but I wouldn't do myself.
moves.6. Nc3 Nd4 7. Ng5: The game now began to get more complicated.
moves.7... O-O 8. Nxf7: Oooh, my opponent made a tactical mistake as a bishop and a knight is stronger than a rook and a pawn- but that can be argued.
moves.8... Rxf7 9. Bxf7+ Kxf7 10. d3 Kg8 11. O: For a while nothing interesting happened in the game.
moves.13. exd5 Nxd5 14. Nxd5 Qxd5: Now I had total control of the centre.
moves.15. c4 Qc6 16. Qh5: It was my opponent's turn to be attackive.
moves.19. Qe8#: I noticed this just as I submitted my move but by then it was too late.
